   30: %% 1222           0 :         } else if (lastput == 0) { /* A multibyte UTF8 character */
   31: %% 1223           0 :             for (i = 0; i < ubytes; ++i) {
   32: %% 1224           0 :                 outc(ubuf[i]);
   33: %% 1225             :             }
   34: %% 1226             :         } else {
   35: %% 1227           0 :             outc(lastput);
   36: %%  - $TERM set to > 1024 long value

   81: -record(tmux, {peer, node, name, ssh_server_name, orig_location }).
   82: suite() ->
   83:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   84:      {timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
   85: 
   86: all() ->
   87:     [{group, to_erl},
   88:      {group, tty},
   89:      {group, ssh}].
   90: 
   91: groups() ->
   92:     [{to_erl,[],
   93:       [get_columns_and_rows_escript,get_columns_and_rows,
   94:        exit_initial, job_control_local,
   95:        job_control_remote, job_control_remote_noshell,

  102:      {shell_history, [],

  179: 
  180: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  181:     Term = os:getenv("TERM", "dumb"),
  182:     os:putenv("TERM", "vt100"),
  183:     [{term,Term}|Config].
  184: 
  185: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  186:     Term = proplists:get_value(term,Config),
  187:     os:putenv("TERM",Term),
  188:     ok.
  189: 
  190: init_per_group(to_erl, Config) ->
  191:     case rtnode:get_progs() of
  192:         {error, Error} ->
  193:             {skip, Error};
  194:         _ ->
  195:             DefShell = rtnode:get_default_shell(),
  196:             [{default_shell,DefShell}|Config]
  197:     end;
  198: init_per_group(remsh, Config) ->
  199:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  200:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  201:         new -> Config
  202:     end;
  203: init_per_group(shell_history, Config) ->
  204:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  205:         old -> {skip, "Not supported in old shell"};
  206:         new -> Config
  207:     end;
  208: init_per_group(Group, Config) when Group =:= tty; Group =:= ssh ->
  209:     case string:split(tmux("-V")," ") of
  210:         ["tmux",[Num,$.|_]] when Num >= $3, Num =< $9 ->
  211:             tmux("kill-session"),
  212:             "" = tmux("-u new-session -x 50 -y 60 -d"),
  213:             ["" = tmux(["set-environment '",Name,"' '",Value,"'"])
  214:              || {Name,Value} <- os:env()],
  215:             Config;
  216:         ["tmux", Vsn] ->
  217:             {skip, "invalid tmux version " ++ Vsn ++ ". Need vsn 3 or later"};
  218:         Error ->
  219:             {skip, "tmux not installed " ++ Error}
  220:     end;
  221: 
  222: init_per_group(Group, Config) when Group =:= tty_unicode;
  223:                                    Group =:= tty_latin1;
  224:                                    Group =:= ssh_unicode;
  225:                                    Group =:= ssh_latin1 ->
  226:     [Lang,_] =
  227:         string:split(
  228:           os:getenv("LC_ALL",
  229:                     os:getenv("LC_CTYPE",
  230:                               os:getenv("LANG","en_US.UTF-8"))),"."),
  231:     case Group of
  232:         tty_unicode ->
  233:             [{encoding, unicode},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".UTF-8"}]}|Config];
  234:         tty_latin1 ->
  235:             % [{encoding, latin1},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".ISO-8859-1"}]}|Config],
  236:             {skip, "latin1 tests not implemented yet"};
  237:         ssh_unicode ->
  238:             [{encoding, unicode},{env,[{"LC_ALL",Lang++".UTF-8"}]}|Config];
  239:         ssh_latin1 ->
  240:             {skip, "latin1 tests not implemented yet"}
  241:     end;
  242: init_per_group(sh_custom, Config) ->
  243:     %% Ensure that ERL_AFLAGS will not override the value of the shell_history variable.
  244:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-noshell","-kernel","shell_history","not_overridden"]),
  245:     try erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, shell_history], rtnode:timeout(normal)) of
  246:         {ok, not_overridden} ->
  247:             Config;
  248:         _ ->
  249:             SkipText = "shell_history variable is overridden (probably by ERL_AFLAGS)",
  250:             {skip, SkipText}
  251:     catch
  252:         C:R:Stk ->
  253:             io:format("~p\n~p\n~p\n", [C,R,Stk]),
  254:             {skip, "Unexpected error"}
  255:     after
  256:         peer:stop(Peer)
  257:     end;
  258: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  259:     Config.
  260: 
  261: end_per_group(Group, _Config) when Group =:= tty; Group =:= ssh ->
  262:     Windows = string:split(tmux("list-windows"), "\n", all),
  263:     lists:foreach(
  264:       fun(W) ->
  265:               case string:split(W, " ", all) of
  266:                   ["0:" | _] -> ok;
  267:                   [No, _Name | _] ->
  268:                       "" = os:cmd(["tmux select-window -t ", string:split(No,":")]),
  269:                       ct:log("~ts~n~ts",[W, os:cmd(lists:concat(["tmux capture-pane -p -e"]))])
  270:               end
  271:       end, Windows),
  272: %    "" = os:cmd("tmux kill-session")
  273:     ok;
  274: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  275:     Config.
  276: 
  277: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) ->
  278:     Path = [Func,
  279:             [proplists:get_value(name,P) ||
  280:                 P <- [proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,Config,[])] ++
  281:                     proplists:get_value(tc_group_path,Config,[])]],
  282:     [{tc_path, lists:concat(lists:join("-",lists:flatten(Path)))} | Config].
  283: 
  284: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  285:     GroupProperties = proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties, Config),
  286:     case (GroupProperties =/= false) andalso proplists:get_value(parallel, GroupProperties, false) of
  287:         true -> ok;
  288:         false ->
  289:             %% Terminate any connected nodes. They may disturb test cases that follow.
  290:             lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
  291:                                   catch erpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, [])
  292:                           end, nodes()),
  293:             ok
  294:     end.
  295: 
  296: %%-define(DEBUG,1).
  297: -ifdef(DEBUG).
  298: -define(dbg(Data),ct:pal("~p",[Data])).
  299: -else.
  300: -define(dbg(Data),noop).
  301: -endif.
  302: 
  303: string_to_term(Str) ->
  304:     try
  305:         {ok,Tokens,_EndLine} = erl_scan:string(Str ++ "."),
  306:         {ok,AbsForm} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  307:         {value,Value,_Bs} = erl_eval:exprs(AbsForm, erl_eval:new_bindings()),
  308:         Value
  309:     catch E:R:ST ->
  310:         ct:log("Could not parse: ~ts~n", [Str]),
  311:         erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  312:     end.
  313: 
  314: run_unbuffer_escript(Rows, Columns, EScript, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut) ->
  315:     DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  316:     TmpFile = filename:join(DataDir, "tmp"),
  317:     ok = file:write_file(TmpFile, <<>>),
  318:     CommandModifier =
  319:         case {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} of
  320:             {false, false} -> "";
  321:             {true, false} -> io_lib:format(" < ~s", [TmpFile]);
  322:             {false, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile]);
  323:             {true, true} -> io_lib:format(" > ~s < ~s ; cat ~s", [TmpFile, TmpFile, TmpFile])
  324:         end,
  325:     Command = io_lib:format("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty rows ~p; stty columns ~p; escript ~s ~s\"",
  326:                             [Rows, Columns, EScript, CommandModifier]),
  327:     %% io:format("Command: ~s ~n", [Command]),
  328:     Out = os:cmd(Command),
  329:     %% io:format("Out: ~p ~n", [Out]),
  330:     string_to_term(Out).
  331: 
  332: get_columns_and_rows_escript(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  333:     ExpectUnbufferInstalled =
  334:         try
  335:             "79" = string:trim(os:cmd("unbuffer -p bash -c \"stty columns 79 ; tput cols\"")),
  336:             true
  337:         catch
  338:             _:_ -> false
  339:         end,
  340:     case ExpectUnbufferInstalled of
  341:         false ->
  342:             {skip,
  343:              "The unbuffer tool (https://core.tcl-lang.org/expect/index) does not seem to be installed.~n"
  344:              "On Ubuntu/Debian: \"sudo apt-get install expect\""};
  345:         true ->
  346:             DataDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "interactive_shell_SUITE_data"),
  347:             IoColumnsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_columns.erl"),
  348:             IoRowsErl = filename:join(DataDir, "io_rows.erl"),
  349:             [
  350:              begin
  351:                  {ok, 42} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut),
  352:                  {ok, 99} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut)
  353:              end
  354:              ||
  355:                 {NoTermStdIn, NoTermStdOut} <- [{false, false}, {true, false}, {false, true}]
  356:             ],
  357:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoRowsErl, true, true),
  358:             {error,enotsup} = run_unbuffer_escript(99, 42, IoColumnsErl, true, true),
  359:             ok
  360:     end.
  361: 
  362: %% Test that the shell can access columns and rows.
  363: get_columns_and_rows(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  364:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
  365: 	old ->
  366:             test_columns_and_rows(old, []);
  367: 	new ->
  368:             test_columns_and_rows(old, ["-oldshell"]),
  369:             test_columns_and_rows(new, [])
  370:     end,
  371:     ok.
  372: 
  373: test_columns_and_rows(old, Args) ->
  374:     rtnode:run(
  375:       [{putline, ""},
  376:        {putline, "2."},
  377:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  378:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  379:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
  380:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  381:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"}
  382:       ], [], [], Args),
  383: 
  384:     rtnode:run(
  385:       [{putline, ""},
  386:        {putline, "2."},
  387:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
  388:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  389:        {expect, "{ok,90}\r\n"},
  390:        {putline,"io:rows()."},
  391:        {expect, "{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  392:       [],
  393:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ",
  394:       Args);
  395: test_columns_and_rows(new, _Args) ->
  396:     rtnode:run(
  397:       [{putline, ""},
  398:        {expect, "1> $"},
  399:        {putline, "2."},
  400:        {expect, "\r\n2\r\n"},
  401:        {expect, "> $"},
  402:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  403:        {expect, "{ok,80}\r\n"},
  404:        {expect, "> $"},
  405:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  406:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,24}\r\n"}
  407:       ]),
  408: 
  409:     rtnode:run(
  410:       [{putline, ""},
  411:        {expect, "1> $"},
  412:        {putline, "2."},
  413:        {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
  414:        {expect, "> $"},
  415:        {putline, "io:columns()."},
  416:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,90}\r\n"},
  417:        {expect, "> $"},
  418:        {putline, "io:rows()."},
  419:        {expect, "\r\n{ok,40}\r\n"}],
  420:       [],
  421:       "stty rows 40; stty columns 90; ").
  422: 
  423: shell_navigation(Config) ->
  424: 
  425:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  426: 
  427:     try
  428:         [begin
  429:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}"),
  430:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward
  431:              check_content(Term, "{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}$"),
  432:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  433:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  434:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  435:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  436:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  437:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  438:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  439:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  440:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  441:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',")}),
  442:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  443:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  444:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  445:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b'")}),
  446:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  447:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,")}),
  448:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  449:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
  450:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  451:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  452:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  453:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc}")}),
  454:              send_tty(Term,"C-H"),
  455:              check_location(Term, {0, width("{aaa,'b"++U++"b',ccc")}),
  456:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  457:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  458:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  459:          end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  460:         ok
  461:     after
  462:         stop_tty(Term)
  463:     end.
  464: shell_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
  465:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  466: 
  467:     try
  468:         [begin
  469:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  470:              send_tty(Term,"{aaa,"),
  471:              check_location(Term, {0,width("{aaa,")}),
  472:              send_tty(Term,"\n'b"++U++"b',"),
  473:              check_location(Term, {0, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  474:              send_tty(Term,"\nccc}"),
  475:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}), %% Check that cursor jump backward (blink)
  476:              timer:sleep(1000), %% Wait for cursor to jump back
  477:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  478:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  479:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  480:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  481:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  482:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  483:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc")}),
  484:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  485:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  486:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  487:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b',")}),
  488:              send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  489:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  490:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
  491:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  492:              %send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  493:              %check_location(Term, {-1, 1}),
  494:              send_tty(Term,"C-Right"),
  495:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U++"b'")}),
  496:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  497:              check_location(Term, {-2, width("{aaa,")}),
  498:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  499:              send_tty(Term,"C-Down"),
  500:              check_location(Term, {0, width("ccc}")}),
  501:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  502:              send_tty(Term,"C-Up"),
  503:              check_location(Term, {-1, width("'b"++U)}),
  504:              send_tty(Term,"M-<"),
  505:              check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
  506:              send_tty(Term,"M->"),
  507:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  508:              check_location(Term, {0,width("ccc")}),
  509:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  510:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  511:              check_location(Term, {0,0}),
  512:              send_tty(Term,"C-h"), % Backspace
  513:              check_location(Term, {-1,width("ccc}")}),
  514:              send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
  515:              send_tty(Term, "End"),
  516:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  517:              send_tty(Term,"M-Enter"),
  518:              check_content(Term, ".. ,"),
  519:              check_location(Term, {-1,0}),
  520:              send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  521:              check_location(Term, {-3,0}),
  522:              send_tty(Term,"{'"++U++"',\n\n\nworks}.\n")
  523:             end || U <- hard_unicode()],
  524:         ok
  525:     after
  526:         stop_tty(Term)
  527:     end.
  528: 
  529: shell_format(Config) ->
  530:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","format_shell_func","{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"]}|Config]),
  531:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  532:     EmacsFormat = "\""++DataDir ++ "emacs-format-file\"\n",
  533:     try
  534:         send_tty(Term1,"fun(X) ->\n  X\nend.\n"),
  535:         send_tty(Term1,"Up"),
  536:         %% Note, erl_pp puts 7 spaces before X
  537:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..        X\\s*.. end."),
  538:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  539:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term1)," -x ",200]),
  540:         timer:sleep(1000),
  541:         send_tty(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func(\"emacs -batch \${file} -l \"\n"),
  542:         send_tty(Term1, EmacsFormat),
  543:         send_tty(Term1, "\" -f emacs-format-function\").\n"),
  544:         check_content(Term1, "{shell,erl_pp_format_func}"),
  545:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  546:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  547:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  548:         timer:sleep(1000),
  549:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  550:         %% Note, emacs-format puts 8 spaces before X
  551:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  552:         send_tty(Term1, "Down"),
  553:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
  554:         send_tty(Term1, "shell:format_shell_func({bad,format}).\n"),
  555:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  556:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  557:         send_tty(Term1, "\n"),
  558:         timer:sleep(1000),
  559:         check_content(Term1, "\\Q* Bad format function: {bad,format}\\E"),
  560:         send_tty(Term1, "Up"),
  561:         %% No modifications should be made, when default format function is used
  562:         check_content(Term1, "fun\\(X\\) ->\\s*..         X\\s*.. end."),
  563:         ok
  564:     after
  565:         stop_tty(Term1)
  566:     end.
  567: shell_multiline_prompt_ssh(Config) ->
  568:     Term1 = start_tty(Config),
  569:     try
  570:         send_tty(Term1, "shell:multiline_prompt_func({shell,inverted_space_prompt}).\n"),
  571:         check_location(Term1, {0, 0}),
  572:         send_tty(Term1,"\na"),
  573:         check_location(Term1, {0, 1}),
  574:         check_content(Term1, "   a"),
  575:         ok
  576:     after
  577:         stop_tty(Term1)
  578:     end.
  579: shell_multiline_prompt(Config) ->
  580:     Term1 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","{shell,inverted_space_prompt}"]}|Config]),
  581:     Term2 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","\"...> \""]}|Config]),
  582:     Term3 = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_multiline_prompt","edlin"]}|Config]),
  583:     Term4 = start_tty(Config),
  584: 
  585:     try
  586:         check_location(Term1, {0, 0}),
  587:         send_tty(Term1,"\na"),
  588:         check_location(Term1, {0, 1}),
  589:         check_content(Term1, "   a"),
  590:         ok
  591:     after
  592:         stop_tty(Term1)
  593:     end,
  594:     try
  595:         check_location(Term2, {0, 0}),
  596:         send_tty(Term2,"\na"),
  597:         check_location(Term2, {0, 1}),
  598:         check_content(Term2, "...> a"),
  599:         ok
  600:     after
  601:         stop_tty(Term2)
  602:     end,
  603:     try
  604:         send_tty(Term3,"\na"),
  605:         check_location(Term3, {0, 1}),
  606:         check_content(Term3, ".. a"),
  607:         ok
  608:     after
  609:         stop_tty(Term3)
  610:     end,
  611:     try
  612:         send_tty(Term4, "shell:multiline_prompt_func(\"-> \").\n"),
  613:         check_content(Term4, "default"),
  614:         send_tty(Term4, "a\nb"),
  615:         check_content(Term4, "-> b"),
  616:         ok
  617:     after
  618:         stop_tty(Term4)
  619:     end.
  620: 
  621: shell_clear(Config) ->
  622: 
  623:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  624:     {Rows, _Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  625: 
  626:     try
  627:         send_tty(Term,"foobar."),
  628:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  629:         check_content(Term, "foobar"),
  630:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  631:         send_tty(Term,"bazbat"),
  632:         check_location(Term, {0, 6}),
  633:         send_tty(Term,"C-L"),
  634:         check_location(Term, {-Rows+1, 6}),
  635:         check_content(Term, "bazbat")
  636:     after
  637:         stop_tty(Term)
  638:     end.
  639: 
  640: shell_xnfix(Config) ->
  641: 
  642:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  643: 
  644:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  645:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  646: 
  647:     As = lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1,"a"),
  648: 
  649:     try
  650:         [begin
  651:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  652:              send_tty(Term,As),
  653:              check_content(Term,[As,$$]),
  654:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - 1}),
  655:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  656:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  657:              send_tty(Term,"aaa"),
  658:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 3}),
  659:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,3 + width(U))],
  660:              send_tty(Term,U),
  661:              %% a{Cols-1}U\naaaaa
  662:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  663:                                  U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  664:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  665:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  666:              send_tty(Term,U),
  667:              %% a{Cols-1}U\nUaaaaa
  668:              check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  669:                                  U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  670:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  671:              %% send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  672:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  673:              %% a{Cols-2}U\nUaaaaa
  674:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  675:              %%                     U,"\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  676:              %% send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  677:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 1 - width(U),$a),
  678:              %%                     U,U,"\n",lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  679:              %% send_tty(Term,"aa"),
  680:              %% check_content(Term,[lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - 2 - width(U),$a),
  681:              %%                     U,"a\n",U,lists:duplicate(3+width(U), $a),"$"]),
  682:              %% check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  683:              send_tty(Term,"C-K"),
  684:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  685:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  686:              check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  687:              send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  688:              check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
  689:              send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  690:              ok
  691:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  692:     after
  693:         stop_tty(Term)
  694:     end.
  695: 
  696: 
  697: %% Characters that are larger than 2 wide need special handling when they
  698: %% are at the end of the current line.
  699: shell_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  700: 
  701:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  702: 
  703:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  704:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  705: 
  706:     try
  707:         [begin
  708:              FirstLine = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U)*2 + 1,"a")],
  709:              OtherLineA = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"a")],
  710:              OtherLineB = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"b")],
  711:              OtherLineC = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"c")],
  712:              OtherLineD = [U,lists:duplicate(Cols - width(U) * 2+1,"d")],
  713:              send_tty(Term,FirstLine),
  714:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  715:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  716: 
  717:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineA),
  718:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  719:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  720: 
  721:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineB),
  722:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  723:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  724: 
  725:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineC),
  726:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  727:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  728: 
  729:              send_tty(Term,OtherLineD),
  730:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  731:              check_location(Term, {0, Cols - Col - width(U)+1}),
  732: 
  733:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  734:              check_location(Term, {-4, 0}), %% Broken
  735:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  736:              check_location(Term, {-4, width(U)}), %% Broken
  737: 
  738:              send_tty(Term,"DC"), %% Broken
  739:              check_content(Term, ["a.*",U,"$"]),
  740:              check_content(Term, ["^b.*",U,"c$"]),
  741:              check_content(Term, ["^c.*",U,"dd$"]),
  742: 
  743:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  744:              check_content(Term, [FirstLine,$$]),
  745:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineA,$$]),
  746:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineB,$$]),
  747:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineC,$$]),
  748:              check_content(Term, [OtherLineD,$$]),
  749: 
  750:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  751:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  752:     after
  753:         stop_tty(Term)
  754:     end.
  755: 
  756: shell_delete(Config) ->
  757: 
  758:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  759: 
  760:     try
  761: 
  762:         [ begin
  763:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  764:               check_content(Term, "> a$"),
  765:               check_location(Term, {0, 1}),
  766:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  767:               check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  768:               check_content(Term, ">$"),
  769:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  770:               send_tty(Term,U),
  771:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a, U])}),
  772:               send_tty(Term,"a"),
  773:               send_tty(Term,U),
  774:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U,$a,U])}),
  775:               check_content(Term, ["> a",U,$a,U,"$"]),
  776:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  777:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  778:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  779:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  780:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  781:               send_tty(Term,U),
  782:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a,U])}),
  783:               send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  784:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  785:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  786:               check_content(Term, ["> aa",U,"$"]),
  787:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  788:               send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  789:               check_content(Term, ["> a$"]),
  790:               send_tty(Term,"C-E"),
  791:               check_location(Term, {0, width([$a])}),
  792:               send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  793:               check_location(Term, {0, width([])})
  794:           end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  795:     after
  796:         stop_tty(Term)
  797:     end.
  798: 
  799: %% When deleting characters at the edge of the screen that are "large",
  800: %% we need to take special care.
  801: shell_delete_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  802: 
  803:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  804: 
  805:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  806:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  807: 
  808:     try
  809:         [begin
  810:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  811:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  812:              send_tty(Term,[U,U,"aaaaa"]),
  813:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,U,"aaaaa$"]),
  814:              [send_tty(Term,"Left") || _ <- lists:seq(1,5+2)],
  815:              check_location(Term,{0,-Col}),
  816:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  817:              check_content(Term,"> a* \n"),
  818:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 1}),
  819:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  820:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  821:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 2}),
  822:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  823:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U," \n"]),
  824:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 3}),
  825:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  826:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"\n"]),
  827:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  828:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 4}),
  829:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  830:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,U,"a\n"]),
  831:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  832:              check_location(Term,{-1,Cols - Col - 5}),
  833:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  834:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  835:     after
  836:         stop_tty(Term)
  837:     end.
  838: 
  839: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  840: %% to take extra care
  841: shell_delete_unicode_not_at_cursor_wrap(Config) ->
  842: 
  843:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  844: 
  845:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  846:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  847: 
  848:     try
  849:         [begin
  850:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col,"a")),
  851:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  852:              send_tty(Term,["a",U,"aaaaa"]),
  853:              check_content(Term,["\na",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  854:              send_tty(Term,"C-A"),
  855:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  856:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  857:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  858:              check_content(Term,["\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  859:              check_content(Term,["> a* \n"]),
  860:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  861:              check_content(Term,["\naaaaa$"]),
  862:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\n"]),
  863:              send_tty(Term,"DC"),
  864:              check_content(Term,["\naaaa$"]),
  865:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"a\n"]),
  866:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  867:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  868:     after
  869:         stop_tty(Term)
  870:     end.
  871: 
  872: %% When deleting characters and a "large" characters is changing line we need
  873: %% to take extra care
  874: shell_update_window_unicode_wrap(Config) ->
  875: 
  876:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  877: 
  878:     {_Rows, Cols} = get_window_size(Term),
  879:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
  880: 
  881:     try
  882:         [begin
  883:              send_tty(Term,lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(U) + 1,"a")),
  884:              check_content(Term,"> a*$"),
  885:              send_tty(Term,[U,"aaaaa"]),
  886:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  887:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols+1]),
  888:              check_content(Term,["> a*",U,"\naaaaa$"]),
  889:              tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",Cols]),
  890:              check_content(Term,["> a* ?\n",U,"aaaaa$"]),
  891:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  892:          end || U <- hard_unicode()]
  893:     after
  894:         stop_tty(Term)
  895:     end.
  896: 
  897: shell_transpose(Config) ->
  898: 
  899:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  900: 
  901:     Unicode = [[$a]] ++ hard_unicode(),
  902: 
  903:     try
  904:         [
  905:          begin
  906:              send_tty(Term,"a"),
  907:              [send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U],
  908:              send_tty(Term,"b"),
  909:              [[send_tty(Term,[CP]) || CP <- U2] || U2 <- Unicode],
  910:              send_tty(Term,"cde"),
  911:              check_content(Term, ["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  912:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["a",U,"b",Unicode,"cde"])}),
  913:              send_tty(Term,"Home"),
  914:              check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  915:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  916:              send_tty(Term,"Right"),
  917:              check_location(Term, {0, 1+width([U])}),
  918:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  919:              check_content(Term, ["ab",U,Unicode,"cde$"]),
  920:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  921:              check_content(Term, ["ab",hd(Unicode),U,tl(Unicode),"cde$"]),
  922:              [send_tty(Term,"C-T") || _ <- lists:seq(1,length(Unicode)-1)],
  923:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,U,"cde$"]),
  924:              send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
  925:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de$"]),
  926:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U])}),
  927:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  928:              check_location(Term, {0, width(["ab",Unicode,"c",U,"de"])}),
  929:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  930:              send_tty(Term,"Left"),
  931:              send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  932:              check_content(Term, ["ab",Unicode,"cde$"]),
  933:              send_tty(Term,"End"),
  934:              send_tty(Term,"Enter")
  935:          end || U <- Unicode],
  936:         ok
  937:     after
  938:         stop_tty(Term),
  939:         ok
  940:     end.
  941: 
  942: shell_search(C) ->
  943:     Term = start_tty(C),
  944: 
  945:     try
  946:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  947:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  948:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  949:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  950:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  951:         send_tty(Term,[16#1f600]),
  952:         send_tty(Term,"'"),
  953:         send_tty(Term,"."),
  954:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  955:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}),
  956:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  957:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  958:         send_tty(Term,"C-a"),
  959:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(C, "'a😀'.")}),
  960:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
  961:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  962:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  963:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
  964:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  965:         send_tty(Term,"C-r"),
  966:         check_content(Term, "search: a\\s*\n\\s*a."),
  967:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  968:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  969:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  970:         check_content(Term, "search:\\s*\n\\s*'a😀'."),
  971:         send_tty(Term,"M-c"),
  972:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
  973:         ok
  974:     after
  975:         stop_tty(Term),
  976:         ok
  977:     end.
  978: 
  979: shell_combining_unicode(Config) ->
  980:     %% Tests that its possible to delete a combining unicode character as
  981:     %% the first character of the input line.
  982:     Term = start_tty(Config),
  983:     X = 0,
  984:     check_location(Term, {X,0}),
  985:     %% COMBINING DIAERESIS, ZWNJ, ZWJ
  986:     CombiningUnicode = [776, 8204, 8205],
  987:     try
  988:         [
  989:             begin
  990:                 send_tty(Term,[J]),
  991:                 send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  992:                 check_location(Term, {X,0}),
  993:                 send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  994:                 check_location(Term, {X,0}),
  995:                 send_tty(Term,[J,$a]),
  996:                 send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  997:                 check_location(Term, {X,0}),
  998:                 send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
  999:                 check_location(Term, {X,0}),
 1000:                 send_tty(Term,[$a,J]),
 1001:                 send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1002:                 check_location(Term, {X,0}),
 1003:                 send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1004:                 check_location(Term, {X,0}),
 1005:                 send_tty(Term,[$",$a,J,$b,$",$.,10]),
 1006:                 check_location(Term, {X,0})
 1007:             end || J <- CombiningUnicode],
 1008:         ok
 1009:     after
 1010:         stop_tty(Term)
 1011:     end.
 1012: 
 1013: shell_insert(Config) ->
 1014:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1015: 
 1016:     try
 1017:         send_tty(Term,"abcdefghijklm"),
 1018:         check_content(Term, "abcdefghijklm$"),
 1019:         check_location(Term, {0, 13}),
 1020:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
 1021:         send_tty(Term,"Right"),
 1022:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
 1023:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
 1024:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
 1025:         send_tty(Term,"C-T"),
 1026:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijklm$"),
 1027:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
 1028:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1029:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1030:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1031:         check_content(Term, "bcdeafghijlm$"),
 1032:         ok
 1033:     after
 1034:         stop_tty(Term)
 1035:     end.
 1036: 
 1037: shell_update_window(Config) ->
 1038:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1039: 
 1040:     Text = lists:flatten(["abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm"]),
 1041:     {_Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
 1042: 
 1043:     try
 1044:         send_tty(Term,Text),
 1045:         check_content(Term,Text),
 1046:         check_location(Term, {0, width(Text)}),
 1047:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col+1]),
 1048:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
 1049:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col}),
 1050:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1051:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
 1052:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text)+Col]),
 1053:         %% When resizing, tmux does not xnfix the cursor, so it will remain
 1054:         %% at the previous locations
 1055:         check_location(Term, {-1, width(Text)}),
 1056:         send_tty(Term,"a"),
 1057:         check_location(Term, {0, -Col + 1}),
 1058: 
 1059:         %% When we do backspace here, tmux seems to place the cursor in an
 1060:         %% incorrect position except when a terminal is attached.
 1061:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1062:         %% This really should be {0, -Col}, but sometimes tmux sets it to
 1063:         %% {-1, width(Text)} instead.
 1064:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col}, {-1, width(Text)}]),
 1065: 
 1066:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x ",width(Text) div 2 + Col]),
 1067:         %% Depending on what happened with the cursor above, the line will be
 1068:         %% different here.
 1069:         check_location(Term, [{0, -Col + width(Text) div 2},
 1070:                               {-1, -Col + width(Text) div 2}]),
 1071:         ok
 1072:     after
 1073:         stop_tty(Term)
 1074:     end.
 1075: shell_small_window_multiline_navigation(Config) ->
 1076:     Term0 = start_tty(Config),
 1077:     tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term0)," -x ",30, " -y ", 6]),
 1078:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term0),
 1079:     Term = Term0#tmux{orig_location = {Row, Col}},
 1080:     Text = ("xbcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
 1081:         "abcdefghijkl\n"++
 1082:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklm\n"++
 1083:         "abcdefghijklmabcdefghijklx"),
 1084:     try
 1085:         send_tty(Term,Text),
 1086:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
 1087:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
 1088:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1089:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
 1090:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
 1091:         send_tty(Term, "C-Down"),
 1092:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1093:         send_tty(Term, "Left"),
 1094:         check_location(Term, {-1, -4}),
 1095:         send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1096:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1097:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4A"),
 1098:         check_location(Term, {-5, 0}),
 1099:         check_content(Term,"xbc"),
 1100:         send_tty(Term, "\e[1;4B"),
 1101:         check_location(Term, {0, -4}),
 1102:         check_content(Term,"klx"),
 1103:         send_tty(Term, " sets:is_e\t"),
 1104:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1105:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1106:         check_location(Term, {-3, 6}),
 1107:         send_tty(Term, "C-Up"),
 1108:         send_tty(Term,"Home"),
 1109:         check_location(Term, {-2, 0}),
 1110:         send_tty(Term, "sets:is_e\t"),
 1111:         check_content(Term,"is_element"),
 1112:         check_content(Term,"is_empty"),
 1113:         check_location(Term, {-4, 9}),
 1114:         send_tty(Term, "M-Enter"),
 1115:         check_location(Term, {-1, 0}),
 1116:         ok
 1117:     after
 1118:         stop_tty(Term)
 1119:     end.
 1120: shell_huge_input(Config) ->
 1121:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1122: 
 1123:     ManyUnicode = lists:duplicate(100,hard_unicode()),
 1124: 
 1125:     try
 1126:         send_tty(Term,ManyUnicode),
 1127:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode_match(Config) ++ "$",
 1128:                       #{ replace => {"\n",""} }),
 1129:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1130:         ok
 1131:     after
 1132:         stop_tty(Term)
 1133:     end.
 1134: output_to_stdout_slowly(5) -> ok;
 1135: output_to_stdout_slowly(N) ->
 1136:     receive
 1137:         after 100 ->
 1138:             io:format("~p~n", [N]),
 1139:             output_to_stdout_slowly(N+1)
 1140:     end.
 1141: 
 1142: shell_receive_standard_out(Config) ->
 1143:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1144:     try
 1145:         send_tty(Term, "spawn(interactive_shell_SUITE, output_to_stdout_slowly, [0]). ABC\n"),
 1146:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1147:         check_location(Term, {0, 0}), %% Check that we are at the same location relative to the start.
 1148:         check_content(Term, "3\\s+4\\s+.+>\\sABC"),
 1149:         ok
 1150:     after
 1151:         stop_tty(Term)
 1152:     end.
 1153: %% Test that the shell works when invalid utf-8 (aka latin1) is sent to it
 1154: shell_invalid_unicode(Config) ->
 1155:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1156: 
 1157:     InvalidUnicode = <<$å,$ä,$ö>>, %% åäö in latin1
 1158: 
 1159:     try
 1160:         send_tty(Term,hard_unicode()),
 1161:         check_content(Term, hard_unicode() ++ "$"),
 1162:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1163:         check_content(Term, "illegal character"),
 1164:         %% Send invalid utf-8
 1165:         send_stdin(Term,InvalidUnicode),
 1166:         %% Check that the utf-8 was echoed
 1167:         check_content(Term, "\\\\345\\\\344\\\\366$"),
 1168:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1169:         %% Check that the terminal entered "latin1" mode
 1170:         send_tty(Term,"😀한."),
 1171:         check_content(Term, "\\Q\\360\\237\\230\\200\\355\\225\\234.\\E$"),
 1172:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1173:         %% Check that we can reset the encoding to unicode
 1174:         send_tty(Term,"io:setopts([{encoding,unicode}])."),
 1175:         send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1176:         check_content(Term, "\nok\n"),
 1177:         send_tty(Term,"😀한"),
 1178:         check_content(Term, "😀한$"),
 1179:         ok
 1180:     after
 1181:         stop_tty(Term),
 1182:         ok
 1183:     end.
 1184: 
 1185: 
 1186: %% Test the we can handle ansi insert, navigation and delete
 1187: %%   We currently can not so skip this test
 1188: shell_support_ansi_input(Config) ->
 1189: 
 1190:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1191: 
 1192:     BoldText = "\e[;1m",
 1193:     ClearText = "\e[0m",
 1194: 
 1195:     try
 1196:         send_tty(Term,["{",BoldText,"a😀b",ClearText,"}"]),
 1197:         timer:sleep(1000),
 1198:         try check_location(Term, {0, width("{1ma😀bm}")}) of
 1199:             _ ->
 1200:                 throw({skip, "Do not support ansi input"})
 1201:         catch _:_ ->
 1202:                 ok
 1203:         end,
 1204:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{a😀b}")}),
 1205:         check_content(fun() -> get_content(Term,"-e") end,
 1206:                       ["{", BoldText, "a😀b", ClearText, "}"]),
 1207:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1208:         send_tty(Term,"Left"),
 1209:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{a😀")}),
 1210:         send_tty(Term,"C-Left"),
 1211:         check_location(Term, {0, width("{")}),
 1212:         send_tty(Term,"End"),
 1213:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1214:         send_tty(Term,"BSpace"),
 1215:         check_content(Term, ["{", BoldText, "a😀"]),
 1216:         ok
 1217:     after
 1218:         stop_tty(Term),
 1219:         ok
 1220:     end.
 1221: 
 1222: shell_expand_location_below(Config) ->
 1223: 
 1224:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1225: 
 1226:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 1227:     {Row, Col} = get_location(Term),
 1228: 
 1229:     NumFunctions = lists:seq(0, Row*2),
 1230:     FunctionName = "a_long_function_name",
 1231: 
 1232:     Module = lists:flatten(
 1233:                ["-module(long_module).\n",
 1234:                 "-export([",lists:join($,,[io_lib:format("~s~p/0",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]),"]).\n\n",
 1235:                 [io_lib:format("~s~p() -> ok.\n",[FunctionName,I]) || I <- NumFunctions]]),
 1236: 
 1237:     DoScan = fun F([]) ->
 1238:                      [];
 1239:                  F(Str) ->
 1240:                      {done,{ok,T,_},C} = erl_scan:tokens([],Str,0),
 1241:                      [ T | F(C) ]
 1242:              end,
 1243:     Forms = [ begin {ok,Y} = erl_parse:parse_form(X),Y end || X <- DoScan(Module) ],
 1244:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info]),
 1245: 
 1246:     try
 1247:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1248:         Cols = 80,
 1249: 
 1250:         %% First check that basic completion works
 1251:         send_tty(Term, "escript:"),
 1252:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1253:         %% Cursor at correct place
 1254:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:")}),
 1255:         %% Nothing after the start( completion
 1256:         check_content(Term, "start\\($"),
 1257: 
 1258:         %% Check that completion is cleared when we type
 1259:         send_tty(Term, "s"),
 1260:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("escript:s")}),
 1261:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1262: 
 1263:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a term
 1264:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1265:         send_tty(Term, "["),
 1266:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1267:         send_tty(Term, ", test_after]"),
 1268:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", test_after]"],
 1269:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1270:         check_location(Term, {-3, width("[escript:s")}),
 1271:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1272:         send_tty(Term, "C-K"),
 1273: 
 1274:         %% Check that completion works when in the middle of a long term
 1275:         send_tty(Term, ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"),
 1276:         [send_tty(Term, "Left") || _ <- ", "++ lists:duplicate(80*2, $a)++"]"],
 1277:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1278:         check_location(Term, {-4, width("[escript:s")}),
 1279:         check_content(Term, "script_name\\([ ]+start\\($"),
 1280:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1281:         send_tty(Term, ".\n"),
 1282: 
 1283:         %% Check that we behave as we should with very long completions
 1284:         rpc(Term, fun() ->
 1285:                           {module, long_module} = code:load_binary(long_module, "long_module.beam", Bin)
 1286:                   end),
 1287:         check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1288:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -y 50"]),
 1289:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1290:         Result = 61,
 1291:         Rows1 = 48,
 1292:         send_tty(Term, "long_module:" ++ FunctionName),
 1293:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1294:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1295: 
 1296:         %% Check that correct text is printed below expansion
 1297:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1298:                                           [1, 7, Result])),
 1299:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1300:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1301:             [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1302:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1303:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1304:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1305:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1306:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1307:                                           [7, Rows1+6, Result])),
 1308:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1309:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1310:                                           [2, Rows1+1, Result])),
 1311:         send_tty(Term, "PgUp"),
 1312:         %% Overshoot up
 1313:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1314:                                           [1, Rows1, Result])),
 1315:         %% Overshoot down
 1316:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1317:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1318:         send_tty(Term, "PgDn"),
 1319:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1320:                                           [14, Rows1+13, Result])),
 1321:         check_content(Term, "\n.*a_long_function_name99\\("),
 1322:         send_tty(Term, "Up"),
 1323:         check_content(Term, io_lib:format("rows ~w to ~w of ~w",
 1324:                                           [13, Rows1+12, Result])),
 1325: 
 1326:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1327: 
 1328:         %% We resize the terminal to make everything fit and test that
 1329:         %% expand below displays everything
 1330:         tmux(["resize-window -t ", tty_name(Term), " -y ", integer_to_list(Row+10)]),
 1331:         timer:sleep(1000), %% Sleep to make sure window has resized
 1332:         send_tty(Term, "\t\t"),
 1333:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name99\\($"),
 1334: 
 1335:         %% Check that doing an expansion when cursor is in xnfix position works
 1336:         send_tty(Term, "BSpace"),
 1337:         check_content(Term, "3> long_module:a_long_function_nam$"),
 1338:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1339:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols - Col - width(", long_module:a_long_function_name"), "a")),
 1340:         send_tty(Term, ", "),
 1341:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1342:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1343:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1344:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1345:         check_content(Term, "3> a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1346:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1347:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1348:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1349:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1350:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 2, -Col}),
 1351: 
 1352:         send_tty(Term, "Home"),
 1353:         send_tty(Term, lists:duplicate(Cols, "b")),
 1354:         send_tty(Term, "End"),
 1355:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1356:         check_content(Term, "3> b+\nb+a+, long_module:" ++ FunctionName ++ "\n\nfunctions(\n|.)*a_long_function_name0\\("),
 1357:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1358:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1359:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1360:         send_tty(Term, "Down"),
 1361:         check_location(Term, {-Rows + 3, -Col}),
 1362: 
 1363:         ok
 1364:     after
 1365:         stop_tty(Term),
 1366:         ok
 1367:     end.
 1368: 
 1369: shell_expand_location_above(Config) ->
 1370: 
 1371:     Term = start_tty([{args,["-stdlib","shell_expand_location","above"]}|Config]),
 1372: 
 1373:     try
 1374:         tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1375:         send_tty(Term, "escript:"),
 1376:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1377:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:")}),
 1378:         check_content(Term, "start\\(\n"),
 1379:         check_content(Term, "escript:$"),
 1380:         send_tty(Term, "s"),
 1381:         send_tty(Term, "\t"),
 1382:         check_location(Term, {0, width("escript:s")}),
 1383:         check_content(Term, "\nscript_name\\([ ]+start\\(\n"),
 1384:         check_content(Term, "escript:s$"),
 1385:         ok
 1386:     after
 1387:         stop_tty(Term),
 1388:         ok
 1389:     end.
 1390: 
 1391: shell_help(Config) ->
 1392:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1393:     try
 1394:         send_tty(Term, "application:put_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, false).\n"),
 1395:         send_tty(Term, "lists"),
 1396:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1397:         %% Check we can see the first line
 1398:         check_content(Term, "List processing functions."),
 1399:         check_not_in_content(Term, "less than or equal to"),
 1400:         %% Expand the help area to take up the whole buffer.
 1401:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1402:         %% Check that we can see the last line (lists help should fit in the window)
 1403:         check_content(Term, "less than or equal to"),
 1404:         send_tty(Term, ":all"),
 1405:         send_tty(Term, "\^[h"),
 1406:         check_content(Term, ~S"all\(Pred, List\)"),
 1407:         ok
 1408:     after
 1409:         stop_tty(Term),
 1410:         ok
 1411:     end.
 1412: 
 1413: prompt_2(_) ->
 1414:     ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"].
 1415: shell_escape_sequence_end_of_prompt_followed_by_unicode(Config) ->
 1416:     %% If the prompt ended with an escape sequence, and the user input a unicode character
 1417:     %% prim_tty tried to put that character in the escape sequence. This test checks that
 1418:     %% the unicode character will not be part of the escape sequence.
 1419:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1420: 
 1421:     try
 1422:         send_tty(Term,"shell:prompt_func(\n"),
 1423:         send_tty(Term,"{interactive_shell_SUITE,\n"),
 1424:         send_tty(Term,"prompt_2}).\n"),
 1425:         send_tty(Term,"÷.\n"),
 1426:         check_content(Term, "syntax error before: '÷'"),
 1427:         ok
 1428:     after
 1429:         stop_tty(Term),
 1430:         ok
 1431:     end.
 1432: 
 1433: %% Test the we can handle invalid ansi escape chars.
 1434: %%   tmux cannot handle this... so we test this using to_erl
 1435: shell_invalid_ansi(_Config) ->
 1436: 
 1437:     InvalidAnsiPrompt =
 1438:         case proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts(user)) of
 1439:             unicode ->
 1440:                 ["\e]94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e]0m"];
 1441:             latin1 ->
 1442:                 ["\e]94minvalid_test\e]0m"]
 1443:         end,
 1444: 
 1445:     rtnode:run(
 1446:       [{eval, fun() -> application:set_env(
 1447:                          stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 1448:                          fun() -> InvalidAnsiPrompt end)
 1449:               end },
 1450:        {putline,"a."},
 1451:        {expect, "a[.]"},
 1452:        {expect, ["\\Q",InvalidAnsiPrompt,"\\E"]}],
 1453:       "", "",
 1454:       ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1455:        "-connect_all","false",
 1456:        "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1457:        "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1458:        "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1459:        "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1460:       ]).
 1461: 
 1462: shell_get_password(_Config) ->
 1463:    
 1464:     rtnode:run(
 1465:       [{putline,"io:get_password(group_leader())."},
 1466:        {putline,"secret\r"},
 1467:        {expect, "\r\n\"secret\""}]),
 1468: 
 1469:     rtnode:run(
 1470:         [{eval,fun() -> shell:start_interactive({noshell, raw}) end},
 1471:         {eval,
 1472:             fun() ->
 1473:                 io:format(user, "Enter password: ", []),
 1474:                 spawn(fun() -> io:format(user, "~nPassword was: ~ts~n",[io:get_password(user)]) end),
 1475:                 ok
 1476:             end},
 1477:         {expect, "Enter password: "},
 1478:         {putline,"secret"},
 1479:         {expect, "^\nPassword was: secret\n"}],
 1480:         "", "", ["-noshell"]),
 1481: 
 1482:     %% io:get_password only works when run in "newshell", or "noshell/raw"
 1483:     rtnode:run(
 1484:       [{putline,"io:get_password()."},
 1485:        {expect, "\\Q{error,enotsup}\\E"}],
 1486:      "","",["-oldshell"]).
 1487: 
 1488: 
 1489: shell_ignore_pager_commands(Config) ->
 1490:     Term = start_tty(Config),
 1491:     case code:get_doc(file, #{sources=>[eep48]}) of
 1492:         {error, _} -> {skip, "No documentation available"};
 1493:         _ ->
 1494:             try
 1495:                 send_tty(Term, "h(file).\n"),
 1496:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qmore (y/n)? (y)\\E"),
 1497:                 send_tty(Term, "n\n"),
 1498:                 check_content(Term,"ok"),
 1499:                 send_tty(Term, "C-P"),
 1500:                 check_content(Term,"\\Qh(file).\\E"),
 1501:                 ok
 1502:             after
 1503:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1504:                 ok
 1505:             end
 1506:     end.
 1507: test_valid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1508:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1509:     Term = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "valid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1510:     set_tty_prompt(Term, Config),
 1511:     try
 1512:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid key"),
 1513:         check_not_in_content(Term, "Invalid function"),
 1514:         send_tty(Term, "asdf"),
 1515:         send_tty(Term, "C-u"),
 1516:         check_content(Term, ">$"),
 1517:         send_tty(Term, "1.\n"),
 1518:         send_tty(Term, "C-b"),
 1519:         check_content(Term, "2>\\s1.$"),
 1520:         ok
 1521:     after
 1522:         stop_tty(Term),
 1523:         ok
 1524:     end.
 1525: 
 1526: test_invalid_keymap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1527:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
 1528:     Term1 = setup_tty([{args, ["-config", DataDir ++ "invalid_keymap.config"]} | Config]),
 1529:     set_tty_prompt(Term1, Config),
 1530:     try
 1531:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid key"),
 1532:         check_content(Term1, "Invalid function"),
 1533:         send_tty(Term1, "asdf"),
 1534:         send_tty(Term1, "C-u"),
 1535:         check_content(Term1, ">$"),
 1536:         ok
 1537:     after
 1538:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1539:         ok
 1540:     end.
 1541: external_editor(Config) ->
 1542:     case os:find_executable("nano") of
 1543:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1544:         _ ->
 1545:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1546:             try
 1547:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1548:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1549:                 send_tty(Term, "\"some text with\nnewline in it\""),
 1550:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1551:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"),
 1552:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1553:                 check_content(Term,"\"some text with\\s*\n\\s*newline in it\""),
 1554:                 send_tty(Term, "Right"),
 1555:                 send_tty(Term, "still"),
 1556:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1557:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1558:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1559:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1560:                 check_content(Term,"3> \"still\\s*\n\\s*.+\\s*some text with\\s*\n.+\\s*newline in it\""),
 1561:                 send_tty(Term,".\n"),
 1562:                 check_content(Term,"\\Q\"still\\nsome text with\\nnewline in it\"\\E"),
 1563:                 ok
 1564:             after
 1565:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1566:                 ok
 1567:             end
 1568:     end.
 1569: 
 1570: external_editor_visual(Config) ->
 1571:     case os:find_executable("vim") of
 1572:         false ->
 1573:             {skip, "vim is not installed"};
 1574:         _ ->
 1575:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1576:             try
 1577:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1578:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1579:                 check_content(Term, "3>"),
 1580:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"VISUAL\",\"vim -u DEFAULTS -U NONE -i NONE\").\n"),
 1581:                 check_content(Term, "4>"),
 1582:                 send_tty(Term,"\"hello"),
 1583:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% Open vim
 1584:                 check_content(Term, "^\"hello"),
 1585:                 send_tty(Term, "$"), %% Set cursor at end
 1586:                 send_tty(Term, "a"), %% Enter insert mode at end
 1587:                 check_content(Term, "-- INSERT --"),
 1588:                 send_tty(Term, "\"."),
 1589:                 send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 1590:                 send_tty(Term,":wq"),
 1591:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1592:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\"[.]$"),
 1593:                 send_tty(Term,"Enter"),
 1594:                 check_content(Term, "\"hello\""),
 1595:                 check_content(Term, "5>$")
 1596:             after
 1597:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1598:                 ok
 1599:             end
 1600:     end.
 1601: 
 1602: external_editor_unicode(Config) ->
 1603:     NanoPath = os:find_executable("nano"),
 1604:     case NanoPath of
 1605:         false -> {skip, "nano is not installed"};
 1606:         _ ->
 1607:             Term = start_tty(Config),
 1608:             try
 1609:                 tmux(["resize-window -t ",tty_name(Term)," -x 80"]),
 1610:                 send_tty(Term,"os:putenv(\"EDITOR\",\"nano\").\n"),
 1611:                 send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1612:                 check_content(Term,"3> " ++ hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1613:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% open external editor (nano)
 1614:                 check_content(Term,"GNU nano [\\d.]+"),
 1615:                 send_tty(Term, "still "),
 1616:                 check_content(Term,"\nstill "),
 1617:                 send_tty(Term, "C-O"), %% save in nano
 1618:                 send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1619:                 send_tty(Term, "C-X"), %% quit in nano
 1620:                 check_content(Term,"still "++hard_unicode_match(Config)),
 1621:                 ok
 1622:             after
 1623:                 stop_tty(Term),
 1624:                 ok
 1625:             end
 1626:     end.
 1627: 
 1628: %% There used to be a race condition when using shell:start_interactive where
 1629: %% the newline handling of standard_error did not change correctly to compensate
 1630: %% for the tty changing to canonical mode
 1631: shell_standard_error_nlcr(Config) ->
 1632: 
 1633:     [
 1634:      begin
 1635:          Term = setup_tty([{env,[{"TERM",TERM}]},{args, ["-noshell"]} | Config]),
 1636:          try
 1637:              rpc(Term, io, format, [standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", []]),
 1638:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest$"),
 1639:              rpc(Term, fun() -> shell:start_interactive(),
 1640:                                 io:format(standard_error,"test~ntest~ntest", [])
 1641:                        end),
 1642:              check_content(Term, "test\ntest\ntest(\n|.)*test\ntest\ntest")
 1643:          after
 1644:              stop_tty(Term)
 1645:          end
 1646:      end || TERM <- ["dumb",os:getenv("TERM")]].
 1647: 
 1648: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1649: shell_suspend(Config) ->
 1650: 
 1651:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1652:     %% In order to suspend `erl` we need it to run in a shell that has job control
 1653:     %% so we start the peer within a tmux window instead of having it be the original
 1654:     %% process.
 1655:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1656: 
 1657:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1658:               post_process_args =>
 1659:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1660:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs =
 1661:                                       lists:join(
 1662:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1663:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1664:                         end
 1665:             },
 1666: 
 1667: 
 1668:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1669: 
 1670:     try
 1671:         send_tty(Term, hard_unicode()),
 1672:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1673:         send_tty(Term, "C-Z"),
 1674:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1675:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1676:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1677:         send_tty(Term, "M-l"),
 1678:         check_content(Term,["2> ",hard_unicode(),"$"]),
 1679:         check_location(Term,{0,width(hard_unicode())}),
 1680:         ok
 1681:     after
 1682:         stop_tty(Term),
 1683:         ok
 1684:     end.
 1685: 
 1686: %% We test that suspending of `erl` and then resuming restores the shell
 1687: shell_full_queue(Config) ->
 1688: 
 1689:     [throw({skip,"Need unbuffer (apt install expect) to run"}) || os:find_executable("unbuffer") =:= false],
 1690: 
 1691:     %% In order to fill the read buffer of the terminal we need to get a
 1692:     %% bit creative. We first need to start erl in bash in order to be
 1693:     %% able to get access to job control for suspended processes.
 1694:     %% We then also wrap `erl` in `unbuffer -p` so that we can suspend
 1695:     %% that program in order to block writing to stdout for a while.
 1696: 
 1697:     Name = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config)),
 1698:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1699: 
 1700:     Peer = #{ name => Name,
 1701:               post_process_args =>
 1702:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1703:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1704:                                       lists:join(
 1705:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1706:                                 ["send","-t",Name,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1707:                         end
 1708:             },
 1709: 
 1710: 
 1711:     Term = start_tty([{peer, Peer}|Config]),
 1712:     UnbufferedPid = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term,os,getpid,[])),
 1713: 
 1714:     WriteUntilStopped =
 1715:         fun F(Char, Term) ->
 1716:                 rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char],[]]),
 1717:                 put(bytes,get(bytes,0)+1),
 1718:                 receive
 1719:                     stop ->
 1720:                         rpc(Term,io,format,[user,[Char+1],[]])
 1721:                 after 0 -> F(Char, Term)
 1722:                 end
 1723:         end,
 1724: 
 1725:     WaitUntilBlocked =
 1726:         fun(Pid, Ref) ->
 1727:                 (fun F(Cnt) ->
 1728:                          receive
 1729:                              {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} = Down ->
 1730:                                  ct:fail({io_format_did_not_block, Down})
 1731:                          after 1000 ->
 1732:                                  ok
 1733:                          end,
 1734:                          case process_info(Pid,dictionary) of
 1735:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,Cnt}]} ->
 1736:                                  ct:log("Bytes until blocked: ~p~n",[Cnt]),
 1737:                                  %% Add one extra byte as for
 1738:                                  %% the current blocking call
 1739:                                  Cnt + 1;
 1740:                              {dictionary,[{bytes,NewCnt}]} ->
 1741:                                  F(NewCnt)
 1742:                          end
 1743:                  end)(0)
 1744:         end,
 1745: 
 1746:     try
 1747:         %% First test that we can suspend and then resume
 1748:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid),
 1749:         check_content(Term,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1750:         {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($a, Term) end),
 1751:         WaitUntilBlocked(Pid, Ref),
 1752:         send_tty(Term, "fg"),
 1753:         send_tty(Term, "Enter"),
 1754:         Pid ! stop,
 1755:         check_content(Term,"b\\s+\\([^)]*\\)2>$")
 1756:     after
 1757:         stop_tty(Term),
 1758:         ok
 1759:     end,
 1760:     Name2 = peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path,Config))++"_2",
 1761:     os:cmd("tmux new-window -n " ++ Name2 ++ " -d -- bash --norc"),
 1762: 
 1763:     Peer2 = #{ name => Name2,
 1764:               post_process_args =>
 1765:                         fun(["new-window","-n",_,"-d","--"|CmdAndArgs]) ->
 1766:                                 FlatCmdAndArgs = ["unbuffer -p "] ++
 1767:                                       lists:join(
 1768:                                         " ",[[$',A,$'] || A <- CmdAndArgs]),
 1769:                                 ["send","-t",Name2,lists:flatten(FlatCmdAndArgs),"Enter"]
 1770:                         end
 1771:             },
 1772: 
 1773:     Term1 = setup_tty([{peer, Peer2},{args, ["-noshell"]}|Config]),
 1774:     UnbufferedPid1 = os:cmd("ps -o ppid= -p " ++ rpc(Term1,os,getpid,[])),
 1775:     try
 1776:         %% Then we test that all characters are written when system
 1777:         %% is terminated just after writing
 1778:         {ok,Cols} = rpc(Term1,io,columns,[user]),
 1779:         send_tty(Term1, "Enter"),
 1780:         os:cmd("kill -TSTP " ++ UnbufferedPid1),
 1781:         check_content(Term1,"\\Q[1]+\\E\\s*Stopped"),
 1782:         {Pid2, Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> WriteUntilStopped($c, Term1) end),
 1783:         Bytes = WaitUntilBlocked(Pid2, Ref2) - 1,
 1784:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1785:         send_tty(Term1, "fg"),
 1786:         send_tty(Term1, "Enter"),
 1787:         check_content(
 1788:           fun() ->
 1789:                   tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term1)])
 1790:           end, lists:flatten([lists:duplicate(Cols,$c) ++ "\n" ||
 1791:                                  _ <- lists:seq(1,(Bytes) div Cols)]
 1792:                              ++ [lists:duplicate((Bytes) rem Cols,$c)])),
 1793:         ct:log("~ts",[tmux(["capture-pane -p -S - -E - -t ",tty_name(Term)])]),
 1794:         ok
 1795:     after
 1796:         stop_tty(Term1),
 1797:         ok
 1798:     end.
 1799: 
 1800: get(Key,Default) ->
 1801:     case get(Key) of
 1802:         undefined ->
 1803:             Default;
 1804:         Value ->
 1805:             Value
 1806:     end.
 1807: 
 1808: %% A list of unicode graphemes that are notoriously hard to render
 1809: hard_unicode() ->
 1810:     ZWJ =
 1811:         case os:type() of
 1812:             %% macOS has very good rendering of ZWJ,
 1813:             %% but the cursor does not agree with it..
 1814:             {unix, darwin} -> [];
 1815:             _ -> [[16#1F91A,16#1F3FC]]    % Hand with skintone 🤚🏼
 1816:         end,
 1817:     [[16#1f600],             % Smilie 😀
 1818:     "한",                   % Hangul
 1819:     "Z̤͔ͧ̑̓","ä͖̭̈̇","lͮ̒ͫ","ǧ̗͚̚","o̙̔ͮ̇͐̇" %% Vertically stacked chars
 1820:      %%"👩‍👩",            % Zero width joiner
 1821:      %%"👩‍👩‍👧‍👦"                % Zero width joiner
 1822:      | ZWJ].
 1823: 
 1824: hard_unicode_match(Config) ->
 1825:     ["\\Q",[unicode_to_octet(Config, U) || U <- hard_unicode()],"\\E"].
 1826: 
 1827: unicode_to_octet(Config, U) ->
 1828:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1829:         unicode -> U;
 1830:         latin1 -> unicode_to_octet(U)
 1831:     end.
 1832: 
 1833: unicode_to_octet(U) ->
 1834:     [if Byte >= 128 -> [$\\,integer_to_list(Byte,8)];
 1835:         true -> Byte
 1836:      end || <<Byte>> <= unicode:characters_to_binary(U)].
 1837: 
 1838: unicode_to_hex(Config, U) ->
 1839:     case ?config(encoding,Config) of
 1840:         unicode -> U;
 1841:         latin1 -> unicode_to_hex(U)
 1842:     end.
 1843: 
 1844: unicode_to_hex(U) when is_integer(U) ->
 1845:     unicode_to_hex([U]);
 1846: unicode_to_hex(Us) ->
 1847:     [if U < 128 -> U;
 1848:         U < 512 -> ["\\",integer_to_list(U,8)];
 1849:         true -> ["\\x{",integer_to_list(U,16),"}"]
 1850:      end || U <- Us].
 1851: 
 1852: width(C, Str) ->
 1853:     case ?config(encoding, C) of
 1854:         unicode -> width(Str);
 1855:         latin1 -> width(unicode_to_octet(Str))
 1856:     end.
 1857: width(Str) ->
 1858:     lists:sum(
 1859:       [npwcwidth(CP) || CP <- lists:flatten(Str)]).
 1860: 
 1861: npwcwidth(CP) ->
 1862:     try prim_tty:npwcwidth(CP)
 1863:     catch error:undef ->
 1864:             if CP =:= 16#D55C ->
 1865:                     2; %% 한
 1866:                CP =:= 16#1f91A ->
 1867:                     2; %% hand
 1868:                CP =:= 16#1F3Fc ->
 1869:                     2; %% Skintone
 1870:                CP =:= 16#1f600 ->
 1871:                     2; %% smilie
 1872:                true ->
 1873:                     case lists:member(CP, [775,776,780,785,786,787,788,791,793,794,
 1874:                                            804,813,848,852,854,858,871,875,878]) of
 1875:                         true ->
 1876:                             0;
 1877:                         false ->
 1878:                             1
 1879:                     end
 1880:             end
 1881:     end.
 1882: 
 1883: tmux([Cmd|_] = Command) when is_list(Cmd) ->
 1884:     tmux(lists:concat(Command));
 1885: tmux(Command) ->
 1886:     string:trim(os:cmd(["tmux ",Command])).
 1887: 
 1888: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, Fun) ->
 1889:     erpc:call(N, Fun).
 1890: rpc(#tmux{ node = N }, M, F, A) ->
 1891:     erpc:call(N, M, F, A).
 1892: 
 1893: %% Setup a TTY, or a ssh server and client but do not type anything in terminal (except password)
 1894: setup_tty(Config) ->
 1895:     ClientName = maps:get(name,proplists:get_value(peer, Config, #{}),
 1896:                     peer:random_name(proplists:get_value(tc_path, Config))),
 1897: 
 1898:     PG = get_top_parent_test_group(Config),
 1899:     Name = if PG =:= ssh ->
 1900:             ClientName ++ "_ssh";
 1901:         true ->
 1902:             ClientName
 1903:     end,
 1904:     Envs = lists:flatmap(fun({Key,Value}) ->
 1905:                                  ["-env",Key,Value]
 1906:                          end, proplists:get_value(env,Config,[])),
 1907: 
 1908:     ExtraArgs = proplists:get_value(args,Config,[]),
 1909: 
 1910:     ExecArgs = case os:getenv("TMUX_DEBUG") of
 1911:                    "strace" ->
 1912:                        STraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1913:                                                  Name++".strace"),
 1914:                        ct:log("Link to strace: file://~ts", [STraceLog]),
 1915:                        [os:find_executable("strace"),"-f",
 1916:                         "-o",STraceLog,
 1917:                         "-e","trace=all",
 1918:                         "-e","read=0,1,2",
 1919:                         "-e","write=0,1,2"
 1920:                        ] ++ string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all);
 1921:                    "rr" ->
 1922:                        [os:find_executable("cerl"),"-rr"];
 1923:                    _ ->
 1924:                        string:split(ct:get_progname()," ",all)
 1925:                end,
 1926:     DefaultPeerArgs = #{ name => Name,
 1927:                          exec =>
 1928:                              {os:find_executable("tmux"),
 1929:                               ["new-window","-n",Name,"-d","--"] ++ ExecArgs },
 1930: 
 1931:                          args => ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1932:                                   "-connect_all","false",
 1933: %                                  "-kernel","logger_level","all",
 1934:                                   "-kernel","shell_history","disabled",
 1935:                                   "-kernel","prevent_overlapping_partitions","false",
 1936:                                   "-eval","shell:prompt_func({interactive_shell_SUITE,prompt})."
 1937:                                  ] ++ Envs ++ ExtraArgs,
 1938:                          wait_boot => 60_000,
 1939:                          detached => false
 1940:                        },
 1941: 
 1942:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
 1943:         ?CT_PEER(maps:merge(proplists:get_value(peer,Config,#{}),
 1944:                             DefaultPeerArgs)),
 1945: 
 1946:     Self = self(),
 1947: 
 1948:     %% By default peer links with the starter. For these TCs we however only
 1949:     %% want the peer to die if we die, so we create a "unidirection link" using
 1950:     %% monitors.
 1951:     spawn(fun() ->
 1952:                   TCRef = erlang:monitor(process, Self),
 1953:                   PeerRef = erlang:monitor(process, Peer),
 1954:                   receive
 1955:                       {'DOWN',TCRef,_,_,Reason} ->
 1956:                           exit(Peer, Reason);
 1957:                       {'DOWN',PeerRef,_,_,_} ->
 1958:                           ok
 1959:                   end
 1960:           end),
 1961:     unlink(Peer),
 1962: 
 1963:     "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",Name," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1964: 
 1965:     %% We start tracing on the remote node in order to help debugging
 1966:     TraceLog = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),Name++".trace"),
 1967:     ct:log("Link to trace: file://~ts",[TraceLog]),
 1968: 
 1969:     spawn(Node,
 1970:           fun() ->
 1971:                   {ok, _} = dbg:tracer(file,TraceLog),
 1972:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv),[c,m]),
 1973:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_writer),[c,m]),
 1974:                   %% dbg:p(whereis(user_drv_reader),[c,m]),
 1975:                   %% dbg:tp(user_drv,x),
 1976:                   %% dbg:tp(prim_tty,x),
 1977:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,write_nif,x),
 1978:                   %% dbg:tpl(prim_tty,read_nif,x),
 1979:                   monitor(process, Self),
 1980:                   receive _ -> ok end
 1981:           end),
 1982:     Tmux = #tmux{ peer = Peer, node = Node, name = ClientName },
 1983:     if PG =:= ssh ->
 1984:             rpc(Tmux, fun() ->
 1985:                 ssh:start(),
 1986:                 PrivDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "nopubkey"),
 1987:                 file:make_dir(PrivDir),
