 1988:                 SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1989:                 {ok, _Sshd} = ssh:daemon(8989, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1990:                                     {user_dir, PrivDir},
 1991:                                     {password, "bar"}])
 1992:             end),
 1993:             os:cmd(os:find_executable("tmux") ++ " new-window -n " ++ ClientName ++ " -d -- "++
 1994:                 "ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null localhost -p 8989 -l foo"),
 1995:             "" = tmux(["set-option -t ",ClientName," remain-on-exit on"]),
 1996: 
 1997:             timer:sleep(2000),
 1998:             check_content(Tmux,"Enter password for \"foo\""),
 1999:             "" = tmux("send -t " ++ ClientName ++ " bar Enter"),
 2000:             timer:sleep(1000),
 2001:             check_content(Tmux,"\\d+\n?>"),
 2002:             Tmux#tmux{ ssh_server_name = Name };
 2003:         true ->
 2004:             Tmux
 2005:     end.
 2006: 
 2007: get_top_parent_test_group(Config) ->
 2008:     maybe
 2009:         GroupPath = proplists:get_value(tc_group_path,Config),
 2010:         [_|_] ?= GroupPath,
 2011:         [{name, Group2}] ?= lists:last(GroupPath),
 2012:         Group2
 2013:     else
 2014:         _ -> proplists:get_value(name,
 2015:                                  proplists:get_value(tc_group_properties,
 2016:                                                                 Config))
 2017:     end.
 2018: 
 2019: set_tty_prompt(Term, Config) ->
 2020:     PG = get_top_parent_test_group(Config),
 2021: 
 2022:     Prompt = fun() -> ["\e[94m",54620,44397,50612,47,51312,49440,47568,"\e[0m"] end,
 2023:     Prompt1 = proplists:get_value(shell_prompt_func_test, Config, Prompt),
 2024: 
 2025:     if PG =:= ssh ->
 2026:             erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 2027:                 [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test, Prompt1]);
 2028:         true ->
 2029:             erpc:call(Term#tmux.node, application, set_env,
 2030:                 [stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test, Prompt1])
 2031:     end.
 2032: 
 2033: %% Start a tty, setup custom prompt and set cursor at bottom
 2034: start_tty(Config) ->
 2035: 
 2036:     Term = setup_tty(Config),
 2037: 
 2038:     set_tty_prompt(Term, Config),
 2039: 
 2040:     {Rows, _} = get_window_size(Term),
 2041: 
 2042:     %% We send a lot of newlines here in order for the number of rows
 2043:     %% in the window to be max so that we can predict what the cursor
 2044:     %% position is.
 2045:     [send_tty(Term,"\n") || _ <- lists:seq(1, Rows)],
 2046: 
 2047:     %% We enter an 'a' here so that we can get the correct orig position
 2048:     %% with an alternative prompt.
 2049:     send_tty(Term,"a.\n"),
 2050:     check_content(Term,"2>$"),
 2051:     OrigLocation = get_location(Term),
 2052:     Term#tmux{ orig_location = OrigLocation }.
 2053: 
 2054: prompt(L) ->
 2055:     N = proplists:get_value(history, L, 0),
 2056:     Fun = application:get_env(stdlib, shell_prompt_func_test,
 2057:                               fun() -> atom_to_list(node()) end),
 2058:     io_lib:format("(~ts)~w> ",[Fun(),N]).
 2059: 
 2060: stop_tty(Term) ->
 2061:     catch peer:stop(Term#tmux.peer),
 2062:     ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term, "-e")]),
 2063:     [ct:log("~ts",[get_content(Term#tmux{ name = Term#tmux.ssh_server_name }, "-e")])
 2064:       || Term#tmux.ssh_server_name =/= undefined],
 2065: %    "" = tmux("kill-window -t " ++ Term#tmux.name),
 2066:     ok.
 2067: 
 2068: tty_name(Term) ->
 2069:     Term#tmux.name.
 2070: 
 2071: send_tty(Term, "Home") ->
 2072:     %% https://stackoverflow.com/a/55616731
 2073:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 2074:     send_tty(Term,"OH");
 2075: send_tty(Term, "End") ->
 2076:     send_tty(Term,"Escape"),
 2077:     send_tty(Term,"OF");
 2078: send_tty(#tmux{ name = Name } = _Term,Value) ->
 2079:     [Head | Quotes] = string:split(Value, "'", all),
 2080:     "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ Head ++ "'"),
 2081:     [begin
 2082:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " \"'\""),
 2083:          "" = tmux("send -t " ++ Name ++ " '" ++ V ++ "'")
 2084:      end || V <- Quotes].
 2085: 
 2086: %% We use send_stdin for testing of things that we cannot sent via
 2087: %% the tmux send command, such as invalid unicode
 2088: send_stdin(Term, Chars) when is_binary(Chars) ->
 2089:     rpc(Term,erlang,display_string,[stdin,Chars]);
 2090: send_stdin(Term, Chars) ->
 2091:     send_stdin(Term, iolist_to_binary(unicode:characters_to_binary(Chars))).
 2092: 
 2093: check_location(Term, Where) ->
 2094:     check_location(Term, Where, 5).
 2095: check_location(Term, Where, Attempt) when is_tuple(Where) ->
 2096:     check_location(Term, [Where], Attempt);
 2097: check_location(#tmux{ orig_location = {OrigRow, OrigCol} = Orig } = Term,
 2098:                Where, Attempt) ->
 2099:     NewLocation = get_location(Term),
 2100:     case lists:any(fun({AdjRow, AdjCol}) ->
 2101:                            {OrigRow+AdjRow,OrigCol+AdjCol} =:= NewLocation
 2102:                    end, Where) of
 2103:         true -> NewLocation;
 2104:         false when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2105:             {NewRow, NewCol} = NewLocation,
 2106:             ct:fail({wrong_location, {expected,Where},
 2107:                      {got,{NewRow - OrigRow, NewCol - OrigCol},
 2108:                       {NewLocation, Orig}}});
 2109:         false ->
 2110:             timer:sleep(50),
 2111:             check_location(Term, Where, Attempt -1)
 2112:     end.
 2113: 
 2114: get_location(Term) ->
 2115:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 2116:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 2117:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 2118: 
 2119: get_window_size(Term) ->
 2120:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 2121:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 2122:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 2123: 
 2124: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 2125:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 2126: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 2127:     Opts = #{},
 2128:     OrigContent = case Term of
 2129:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 2130:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 2131:     end,
 2132:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 2133:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 2134:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 2135:                 error ->
 2136:                     OrigContent
 2137:                 end,
 2138:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 2139:         {match,_} ->
 2140:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 2141:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 2142:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 2143:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 2144:             ct:fail(match);
 2145:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2146:             ok;
 2147:         _ ->
 2148:             timer:sleep(500),
 2149:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 2150:     end.
 2151: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 2152:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 2153: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 2154:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 2155: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 2156:     OrigContent = case Term of
 2157:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 2158:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 2159:               end,
 2160:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 2161:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 2162:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 2163:                   error ->
 2164:                       OrigContent
 2165:               end,
 2166:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 2167:         {match,_} ->
 2168:             ok;
 2169:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 2170:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 2171:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 2172:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 2173:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 2174:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 2175:         _ ->
 2176:             timer:sleep(500),
 2177:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 2178:     end.
 2179: 
 2180: get_content(Term) ->
 2181:     get_content(Term, "").
 2182: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 2183:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 2184:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 2185:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 2186:             C;
 2187:         [C] ->
 2188:             C
 2189:     end.
 2190: 
 2191: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 2192: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2193:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2194: 	old ->
 2195:             test_exit_initial(old);
 2196:         new ->
 2197:             test_exit_initial(old),
 2198:             test_exit_initial(new)
 2199:     end,
 2200:     ok.
 2201: 
 2202: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 2203:     rtnode:run(
 2204:       [{putline, ""},
 2205:        {putline, "2."},
 2206:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 2207:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2208:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2209:        {putline, ""},
 2210:        {putline, "35."},
 2211:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 2212:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 2213: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 2214:     rtnode:run(
 2215:       [{putline, ""},
 2216:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2217:        {putline, "2."},
 2218:        {expect, "2"},
 2219:        {putline,"exit()."},
 2220:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2221:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2222:        {putline, "35."},
 2223:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2224: 
 2225: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2226:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2227:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2228:         {error, Reason} ->
 2229:             {skip, Reason};
 2230:         Tempdir ->
 2231:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2232:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2233:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2234:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2235:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2236:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2237:             ok
 2238:     end.
 2239: 
 2240: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2241: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2242: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2243: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2244: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2245: %% on the current line.
 2246: %%
 2247: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2248: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2249: %% newline to happen.
 2250: %%
 2251: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2252: %% we should.
 2253: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2254:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2255:         new ->
 2256:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2257:             rtnode:run(
 2258:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2259:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2260:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2261:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2262:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2263:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2264:               ],
 2265:               [],
 2266:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2267:         _ ->
 2268:             ok
 2269:     end,
 2270:     ok.
 2271: 
 2272: noshell_raw(Config) ->
 2273: 
 2274:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2275:         new ->
 2276: 
 2277:             TCGl = group_leader(),
 2278:             TC = self(),
 2279: 
 2280:             TestcaseFun = fun() ->
 2281:                                   link(TC),
 2282:                                   group_leader(whereis(user), self()),
 2283: 
 2284:                                   try
 2285:                                     %% Make sure we are in unicode encoding
 2286:                                     unicode = proplists:get_value(encoding, io:getopts()),
 2287: 
 2288:                                     %% "\el" is an artifact from the attaching to_erl program
 2289:                                     "\el" ++ "hello\n" = io:get_line("1> "),
 2290:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2291:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, raw}),
 2292: 
 2293:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2294: 
 2295:                                     %% Test that we can receive 1 char when N is 100
 2296:                                     [$\^p] = io:get_chars("2> ", 100),
 2297: 
 2298:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2299: 
 2300:                                     %% Test that we only receive 1 char when N is 1
 2301:                                     "a" = io:get_chars("3> ", 1),
 2302:                                     "bc" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2303: 
 2304:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2305: 
 2306:                                     %% Test that get_chars counts characters not bytes
 2307:                                     ok = io:setopts([binary]),
 2308:                                     ~b"å" = io:get_chars("4> ", 1),
 2309:                                     ~b"äö" = io:get_chars("", 2),
 2310: 
 2311:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2312: 
 2313:                                     %% Test that echo works
 2314:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, true}]),
 2315:                                     ~b"åäö" = io:get_chars("5> ", 100),
 2316:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, false}]),
 2317: 
 2318:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2319: 
 2320:                                     %% Test that get_line works
 2321:                                     ~b"a\n" = io:get_line("6> "),
 2322: 
 2323:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2324: 
 2325:                                     %% Test that get_until works
 2326:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, true}]),
 2327:                                     ~b"a,b,c" = io:request({get_until, unicode, "7> ", ?MODULE, get_until, []}),
 2328:                                     ok = io:setopts([{echo, false}]),
 2329: 
 2330:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2331: 
 2332:                                     %% Test that we can go back to cooked mode
 2333:                                     ok = shell:start_interactive({noshell, cooked}),
 2334:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2335:                                     ~b"abc" = io:get_chars(user, "8> ", 3),
 2336:                                     io:format(TCGl, "TC Line: ~p~n", [?LINE]),
 2337:                                     ~b"\n" = io:get_chars(user, "", 1),
 2338: 
 2339:                                     io:format("exit")
 2340:                                   catch E:R:ST ->
 2341:                                     io:format(TCGl, "~p", [{E, R, ST}])
 2342:                                   end
 2343:                           end,
 2344: 
 2345:             rtnode:run(
 2346:               [
 2347:                {eval, fun() -> spawn(TestcaseFun), ok end},
 2348: 
 2349:                %% Test io:get_line in cookec mode
 2350:                {expect, "1> $"},
 2351:                {putline, "hello"},
 2352: 
 2353:                %% Test io:get_chars 100 in  raw mode
 2354:                {expect, "2> $"},
 2355:                {putdata, [$\^p]},
 2356: 
 2357:                %% Test io:get_chars 1 in raw mode
 2358:                {expect, "3> $"},
 2359:                {putdata, "abc"},
 2360: 
 2361:                %% Test io:get_chars unicode
 2362:                {expect, "4> $"},
 2363:                {putdata, ~b"åäö"},
 2364: 
 2365:                %% Test that raw + echo works
 2366:                {expect, "5> $"},
 2367:                {putdata, ~b"åäö"},
 2368:                {expect, "åäö$"},
 2369: 
 2370:                %% Test io:get_line in raw mode
 2371:                {expect, "6> $"},
 2372:                {putdata, "a\r"}, %% When in raw mode, \r is newline.
 2373: 
 2374:                %% Test io:get_until in raw mode
 2375:                {expect, "7> $"},
 2376:                {putline, "a"},
 2377:                {expect, "a\n7> $"},
 2378:                {putline, "b"},
 2379:                {expect, "b\n7> $"},
 2380:                {putdata, "c."},
 2381:                {expect, "c.$"},
 2382: 
 2383:                %% Test io:get_line in cooked mode
 2384:                {expect, "8> $"},
 2385:                {putdata, "a"},
 2386:                {expect, "a"},
 2387:                {putdata, "b"},
 2388:                {expect, "b"},
 2389:                {putline, "c"},
 2390:                {expect, "c\r\n$"},
 2391: 
 2392:                {expect, "exit$"}
 2393:               ], [], [],
 2394:               ["-noshell","-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]);
 2395:         _ -> ok
 2396:     end,
 2397:     ok.
 2398: 
 2399: get_until(start, NewChars) ->
 2400:     get_until([], NewChars);
 2401: get_until(State, NewChars) ->
 2402:     Chars = State ++ NewChars,
 2403:     case string:split(Chars, ".") of
 2404:         [Chars] -> {more, Chars ++ ","};
 2405:         [Before, After] -> {done, [C || C <- Before, C =/= $\n], After}
 2406:     end.
 2407: 
 2408: 
 2409: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2410: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2411: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2412: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2413: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2414: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2415: %% commands.
 2416: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2417:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2418:     rtnode:run(
 2419:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2420:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2421:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2422:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2423:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2424:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2425:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2426:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2427:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2428:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2429:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2430:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2431:     rtnode:run(
 2432:       [{sleep,100},
 2433:        {putline, ""},
 2434:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2435:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2436:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2437:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2438:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2439:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2440:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2441:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2442:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2443:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2444:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2445:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2446:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2447:       ], [], [],
 2448:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2449:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2450: 
 2451:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2452:     rtnode:run(
 2453:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2454:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2455:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2456:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2457:        ], [], [],
 2458:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2459:     ok.
 2460: 
 2461: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2462:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2463:     rtnode:run(
 2464:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2465:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2466:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2467:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2468:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2469:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2470: 
 2471:     {ok, Logs} =
 2472:         rtnode:run(
 2473:           [{sleep,100},
 2474:            {putline, ""},
 2475:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2476:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2477:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2478:            {expect, "echo"}
 2479:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2480:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2481: 
 2482:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2483:       "erlang.log.1",
 2484:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2485:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2486: 
 2487:     ok.
 2488: 
 2489: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2490:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2491:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2492:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2493:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2494:     try
 2495:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2496:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2497: 
 2498:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2499:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2500:             rtnode:run(
 2501:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2502:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2503:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2504: 
 2505:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2506:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2507: 
 2508:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2509:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2510:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2511:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2512:             rtnode:run(
 2513:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2514:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2515:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2516: 
 2517:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2518: 
 2519:     after
 2520:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2521:     end,
 2522:     ok.
 2523: 
 2524: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2525:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2526: 
 2527:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2528:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2529: 
 2530:     {ok, Logs} =
 2531:         rtnode:run(
 2532:           [{putline, ""},
 2533:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2534:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2535:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2536:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2537: 
 2538:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2539:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2540:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2541:                       false,
 2542:                       Logs),
 2543:     ok.
 2544: 
 2545: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2546:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2547: 
 2548:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2549:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2550: 
 2551:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2552:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2553:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2554:     ok = file:close(D),
 2555: 
 2556:     {ok, Logs} =
 2557:         rtnode:run(
 2558:           [{putline, ""},
 2559:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2560:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2561:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2562:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2563: 
 2564:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2565:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2566:                       Logs),
 2567:     ok.
 2568: 
 2569: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2570:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2571: 
 2572:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2573:     rtnode:run(
 2574:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2575:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2576:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2577:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2578:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2579: 
 2580:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2581:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2582:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2583:     ok = file:close(D),
 2584: 
 2585:     {ok, Logs} =
 2586:         rtnode:run(
 2587:           [{putline, ""},
 2588:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2589:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2590:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2591:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2592:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2593: 
 2594:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2595:     ok.
 2596: 
 2597: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2598: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2599:     try
 2600:         rtnode:run(
 2601:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2602:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2603:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2604:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2605:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2606:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2607:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2608:     catch
 2609:         _:_ ->
 2610:             ok
 2611:     end.
 2612: 
 2613: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2614:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2615:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2616: 
 2617: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2618:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2619:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2620:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2621:     ].
 2622: 
 2623: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2624:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2625:     rtnode:run(
 2626:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2627:        %% {putline, ""},
 2628:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2629:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2630:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2631:        {putline, "echo."},
 2632:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2633:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2634:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2635:     ok.
 2636: 
 2637: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2638: 
 2639:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2640:     %% provider module.
 2641:     rtnode:run(
 2642:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2643:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2644:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2645:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2646: 
 2647:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2648:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2649:     rtnode:run(
 2650:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2651:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2652:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2653:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2654:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2655: 
 2656:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2657:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2658:     rtnode:run(
 2659:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2660:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2661:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2662:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2663:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2664: 
 2665:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2666:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2667:     rtnode:run(
 2668:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2669:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2670:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2671:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2672:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2673:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2674: 
 2675:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2676:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2677:     rtnode:run(
 2678:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2679:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2680:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2681:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2682:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2683:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2684: 
 2685:     ok.
 2686: 
 2687: shell_history_toggle(_Config) ->
 2688: 
 2689:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2690:     %% provider module.
 2691:     rtnode:run(
 2692:       [
 2693:        {putline, "io:setopts(user, [{line_history, true}])."},
 2694:        {expect, "{error,enotsup}\r\n"},
 2695: 
 2696:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer
 2697:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("").'},
 2698:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2699:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2700:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2701:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("").\\E'},
 2702:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2703:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2704: 
 2705:        %% Test that io:get_line does save into history buffer when enabled
 2706:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, true}])."},
 2707:        {expect, "ok\r\n"},
 2708:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("> ").'},
 2709:        {putline, ~s'hello again'},
 2710:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello again\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2711:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2712:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2713:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2714:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("> ").\\E'},
 2715:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2716:        {expect, ~s'hello again'},
 2717:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2718:        {expect, ~s'> $'},
 2719: 
 2720:        %% Test that io:get_line does not save into history buffer when disabled
 2721:        {putline, "io:setopts([{line_history, false}])."},
 2722:        {putline, ~s'io:get_line("| ").'},
 2723:        {putline, ~s'hello'},
 2724:        {expect, ~s'\\Q"hello\\n"\r\n\\E'},
 2725:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, %% Up key
 2726:        {expect, ~s'\\Qio:get_line("| ").\\E'},
 2727:        {putdata, [$\^n]},  %% Down key
 2728:        {expect, ~s'> $'}
 2729:       ], [], [], ["-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2730: 
 2731:         ok.
 2732: 
 2733: load() ->
 2734:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2735:         {ok, crash} ->
 2736:             error(crash);
 2737:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2738:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2739:             ok;
 2740:         _ ->
 2741:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2742:     end.
 2743: 
 2744: add(_Line) ->
 2745:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2746:         {ok, crash} ->
 2747:             error(crash);
 2748:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2749:             %% Should return ok
 2750:             {error, badreturn};
 2751:         _ ->
 2752:             io:format("!", [])
 2753:     end.
 2754: 
 2755: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2756: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2757:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2758: 	old ->
 2759: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2760: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2761: 	new ->
 2762: 	    %% New shell tests
 2763: 	    rtnode:run(
 2764:               [{putline, ""},
 2765:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2766:                {putline, "2."},
 2767:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2768:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2769:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2770:                {putline, "s"},
 2771:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2772:                {putline, "c"},
 2773:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2774:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2775:                {putline, "35."},
 2776:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2777:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2778:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2779:                {sleep, 6000},
 2780:                {expect, "Command is taking a long time"},
 2781:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2782:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2783:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2784:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2785:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2786:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2787:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2788:                {putline, "c"},
 2789:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2790:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2791:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2792:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2793:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2794:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2795:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2796:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2797:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2798:                {putline, "k"},
 2799:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2800:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2801:                {putline, "c"},
 2802:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2803:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2804:                {putline, "i"},
 2805:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2806:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2807:                {putline, "?"},
 2808:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2809:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2810:                {putline, "h"},
 2811:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2812:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2813:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2814:                {sleep, 100},
 2815:                {putline, ""},
 2816:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2817:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2818:                {sleep, 100},
 2819:                {putline, ""},
 2820:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2821:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2822:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2823:                {putline, "35."},
 2824:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2825:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2826:               ]),
 2827:             ok
 2828:     end.
 2829: 
 2830: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2831: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2832:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2833: 	old ->
 2834: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2835: 	_ ->
 2836:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2837:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2838:             try
 2839:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2840:             after
 2841:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2842:             end
 2843:     end.
 2844: 
 2845: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2846: %% -noshell node.
 2847: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2848:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2849: 	old ->
 2850: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2851: 	_ ->
 2852: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2853:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2854:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2855:             try
 2856:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2857:             after
 2858:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2859:             end
 2860:     end.
 2861: 
 2862: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2863:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2864:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2865:                                    receive die ->
 2866:                                            ok
 2867:                                    end
 2868:                            end),
 2869:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2870:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2871:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2872:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2873: 
 2874:     rtnode:run(
 2875:       [{putline, ""},
 2876:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2877:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2878:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2879:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2880:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2881:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2882:        {putline, "j"},
 2883:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2884:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2885:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2886:        {putline, "c"},
 2887:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2888:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2889:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2890:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2891:        {expect, PidStr},
 2892:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2893:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2894:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2895:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2896:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2897:        {putline, "j"},
 2898:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2899:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2900:        {putline, "c"},
 2901:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2902:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2903:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2904:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2905:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2906:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2907:        {putline, "j"},
 2908:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2909:        {putline, "c"},
 2910:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2911:        {sleep, 100},
 2912:        {putline, "35."},
 2913:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2914:       ], RemNode),
 2915:     Pid ! die,
 2916:     ok.
 2917: 
 2918: %% Tests various control keys.
 2919: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2920:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2921:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2922:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2923:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2924:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2925:     rtnode:run(
 2926:       [{putline,""},
 2927:        {putline,"2."},
 2928:        {expect,"2"},
 2929:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2930:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2931:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2932:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2933:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2934:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2935:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2936:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2937:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2938:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2939:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2940:     ok.
 2941: 
 2942: wordLeft() ->
 2943:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2944:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2945:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2946:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2947: 
 2948: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2949:     End = "\eOF",
 2950:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2951:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2952: 
 2953: wordRight() ->
 2954:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2955:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2956:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2957:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2958: 
 2959: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2960:     Home = "\eOH",
 2961:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2962:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2963: 
 2964: %% Test that -remsh works
 2965: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2966:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2967:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2968:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2969: 
 2970:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2971:                {putline,"node()."},
 2972:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2973: 
 2974:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2975: 
 2976:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2977:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2978:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2979:     rtnode:run(
 2980:       PreCmds ++
 2981:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2982:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2983:           PostCmds,
 2984:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2985: 
 2986:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2987:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2988: 
 2989:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2990:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2991:                [], " ",
 2992:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2993: 
 2994:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2995: 
 2996:     ok.
 2997: 
 2998: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2999: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 3000:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 3001:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 3002: 
 3003: quit_hosting_node() ->
 3004:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 3005:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 3006:      {expect, "--> $"},
 3007:      {putline, "s"},
 3008:      {expect, "--> $"},
 3009:      {putline, "c"},
 3010:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 3011:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 3012: 
 3013: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 3014: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3015:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 3016:     Domain =
 3017:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 3018:             [] ->
 3019:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 3020:             _ -> ""
 3021:         end,
 3022:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 3023:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 3024:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 3025:             try
 3026:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 3027:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 3028:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 3029:                 try
 3030:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 3031:                            SNode,
 3032:                            STPid,
 3033:                            [{putline, ""},
 3034:                             {putline, "node()."},
 3035:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 3036:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 3037:                            CNode,
 3038:                            CTPid,
 3039:                            [{putline, ""},
 3040:                             {putline, "node()."},
 3041:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3042:                 after
 3043:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 3044:                 end
 3045:             after
 3046:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 3047:             end;
 3048:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 3049:             Else
 3050:     end.
 3051: 
 3052: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 3053: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3054:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 3055:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 3056:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 3057:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 3058:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 3059:             try
 3060:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 3061:                        SNode,
 3062:                        STPid,
 3063:                        [{putline, ""},
 3064:                         {putline, "node()."},
 3065:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 3066:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 3067:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 3068:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 3069:                 try
 3070:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 3071:                            CNode,
 3072:                            CTPid,
 3073:                            [{putline, ""},
 3074:                             {putline, "node()."},
 3075:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3076:                 after
 3077:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 3078:                 end
 3079:             after
 3080:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 3081:             end;
 3082:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 3083:             Else
 3084:     end.
 3085: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3086:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 3087:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 3088:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 3089:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 3090:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 3091:             try
 3092:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 3093:                        STPid,
 3094:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 3095:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 3096:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3097:             after
 3098:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 3099:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 3100:             end;
 3101:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 3102:     end.
 3103: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3104:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 3105:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 3106:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 3107:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 3108:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 3109:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 3110:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 3111:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 3112:                     try
 3113:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 3114:                             STPid,
 3115:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 3116:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 3117:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 3118:                     after
 3119:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 3120:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 3121:                     end;
 3122:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 3123:             end
 3124:     end.
 3125: 
 3126: printed_atom(A) ->
 3127:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
